TITLE_TEXT: [check113] Ensure MFA is enabled for the root account
CHECK_RESULT_EXTENDED: us-east-1: MFA is not ENABLED for root account
CHECK_ASFF_TYPE: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards/CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark
CHECK_RISK: The root account is the most privileged user in an AWS account. MFA adds an extra layer of protection on top of a user name and password. With MFA enabled when a user signs in to an AWS website they will be prompted for their user name and password as well as for an authentication code from their AWS MFA device.
